snippet: Representative Charles B. Rangel and State Senator Adriano Espaillat courted voters in the Bronx and Harlem with promises of job growth.
abstract: Rep Charles B Rangel and his top rival, State Sen Adriano Espaillat, court voters with less than three weeks to go until Democratic primary for Rangel's seat in Congress; both promise to bring much-needed jobs to struggling Harlem and Bronx neighborhoods that make up district; race will show if longevity of Rangel, who is fighting for 23rd term in office, is asset or weakness.
lead_paragraph: Representative Charles B. Rangel and State Senator Adriano Espaillat courted voters in the Bronx and Harlem with promises of job growth.

headline.main: In Race for Rangel’s Seat, Top Rivals Promise Job Growth in Struggling Areas
headline.print_headline: In Race for Rangel’s Seat, Leading Rivals Promise Job Growth in Struggling Areas
